meanings.definition: The act of promoting or advancing someone to a higher position or rank.
meanings.sent1: His preferment to manager brought him great joy.
meanings.sent2: She eagerly awaited news of her preferment to team leader.
meanings.sent3: The preferment of the new intern raised some eyebrows in the office.
meanings.sent4: Her preferment to captain of the team was like a dream come true.
meanings.sent5: The preferment of the top student to class president was well-deserved.

meanings.definition: The state of being preferred or favored over others.
meanings.sent1: His preferment among the group was evident by how they always included him.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sense of preferment when she was chosen as the lead actress.
meanings.sent3: The cat's preferment for the red ball over the blue one was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The preferment of the sunny weather over rainy days lifted everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The preferment of her homemade cookies at the bake sale made her proud.
